title: Tools for Cross-Section Hydrological Data
text: excess package designed provide set tools workflows analyze interpret hydrological cross-sectional data. package currently development, use caution 😄.

title: Tools for Cross-Section Hydrological Data
text: can install development version excess GitHub :

title: Tools for Cross-Section Hydrological Data
text: hood, xs_area() function calculates area cross-section use trapezoidal rule, provided pracma package. can visualize cross-sections xs_ribbon()
code: library(excess)  head(testdata) #> # A tibble: 6 x 3 #>    TAPE InvertRod Bankful #>   <dbl>     <dbl>   <dbl> #> 1  0        -0.83   -3.29 #> 2  1        -1.01   -3.29 #> 3  3        -1.48   -3.29 #> 4  4.7      -1.19   -3.29 #> 5  5.95     -1.19   -3.29 #> 6  9.8      -1.93   -3.29 ## If you can't find the `testdata` object, load it with data()  data(testdata) xs_area(testdata) #> [1] 23.4665 xs_ribbon(testdata)

title: Calculate trapezoidal-rule area for two vectors — trap_area
text: double calculated area

title: Cross-Sectional area — xs_area
text: Calculate area cross-section using trapezoidal rule integration. default, uses columns "TAPE" measurement across xs, "InvertRod" depth relative y = 0, "Bankful" baseline measurement.

title: Cross-Sectional area — xs_area
code: xs_area(data, tape = NULL, depth = NULL, baseline = NULL)

title: Cross-Sectional area — xs_area
text: data data.frame cross-section data tape Either numeric vector tape readings ("x coordinates"). depth Either numeric vector rod readings ("y coordinates"). baseline Either double representing bankfull level.

title: Cross-Sectional area — xs_area
text: Double cross-sectional area compared baseline

what: Generate an area plot using ggplot2 — xs_ribbon
title: Generate an area plot using ggplot2 — xs_ribbon
text: xs_area() creates area plot cross-section, using ggplot2::geom_ribbon(). Currently, small inaccuracies exist channel bed crosses y-intercept created baseline, function visualization . (hopefully) fixed future version package.

title: Generate an area plot using ggplot2 — xs_ribbon
Generate an area plot using ggplot2 — xs_ribbon
text: .data data.frame cross-section data x_cor column x-coordinates (default, TAPE) depth column rod readings, relative 0 (.e. >0) (default, InvertRod) baseline column baseline readings (default, Bankful) ... arguments passed methods.

title: Generate an area plot using ggplot2 — xs_ribbon
text: object class ggplot
